item.title: [C/++] Some basic enum stuff
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

i was bored, here you go

[code=c]#include <stdlib.h>
#include <stdio.h>
#ifdef _WIN32
#include <string.h>
#define strcasecmp strcmpi
#else
#include <strings.h>
#endif

struct planet_s
{
char name[8];
float factor;
} planets[] = {
{ “MERCURY”, 0.4155f },
{ “VENUS”, 0.8975f },
{ “EARTH”, 1.0f },
{ “MARS”, 0.3507f },
{ “JUPITER”, 2.5374f },
{ “SATURN”, 1.0677f },
{ “URANUS”, 0.8947f },
{ “NEPTUNE”, 1.1794f },
{ “PLUTO”, 0.0899f }
};

#define PLANET_COUNT (sizeof(planets) / sizeof(struct planet_s))

int main(int argc, char** argv)
{
int index;
float weight;
char planet[20];

printf("enter your weight: ");
scanf("%f", &weight);
printf("enter a planet: ");
scanf("%s", planet);

for (index = 0; index < PLANET_COUNT; index++)
{
    if (!strcasecmp(planet, planets[index].name))
        break;
}

if (index == PLANET_COUNT)
    printf("planet not known\n");
else
    printf("your weight on %s is %.3f\n", planets[index].name, planets[index].factor * weight);

return EXIT_SUCCESS;

}
[/code]

doesnt that look neater

Read full topic

item.title: [C/++] Some basic enum stuff
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

[code=cpp]#include
#include
#include

using namespace std;

enum Planets { MERCURY, VENUS, EARTH, MOON, MARS, JUPITER, SATURN, URANUS, NEPTUNE, PLUTO };

void str_to_upper(string& str);

int main()
{
float weight;
string planet;
Planets inPlanet;
cout << "Enter your weight: ";
cin >> weight;
cout << "Enter a planet: ";
cin >> planet;
str_to_upper(planet);
if(planet == “MERCURY”)
{
inPlanet = MERCURY;
}
else if(planet == “VENUS”)
{
inPlanet = VENUS;
}
else if(planet == “EARTH”)
{
inPlanet = EARTH;
}
else if(planet == “MOON”)
{
inPlanet = MOON;
}
else if(planet == “MARS”)
{
inPlanet = MARS;
}
else if(planet == “JUPITER”)
{
inPlanet = JUPITER;
}
else if(planet == “SATURN”)
{
inPlanet = SATURN;
}
else if(planet == “URANUS”)
{
inPlanet = URANUS;
}
else if(planet == “NEPTUNE”)
{
inPlanet = NEPTUNE;
}
else if(planet == “PLUTO”)
{
inPlanet = PLUTO;
}
else
{
cout << “Invalid planet specified.” << endl;
return 1;
}
cout << "Your weight on ";
switch(inPlanet)
{
case 0: //MERCURY
cout << "Mercury is: " << weight * 0.4155;
break;
case 1: //VENUS
cout << "Venus is: " << weight * 0.8975;
break;
case 2: //EARTH
cout << "Earth is: " << weight * 1.0;
break;
case 3: //MOON
cout << "Moon is: " << weight * 0.166;
break;
case 4: //MARS
cout << "Mars is: " << weight * 0.3507;
break;
case 5: //JUPITER
cout << "Jupiter is: " << weight * 2.5374;
break;
case 6: //SATURN
cout << "Saturn is: " << weight * 1.0677;
break;
case 7: //URANUS
cout << "Uranus is: " << weight * 0.8947;
break;
case 8: //NEPTUNE
cout << "Neptune is: " << weight * 1.1794;
break;
case 9: //PLUTO
cout << "Pluto is: " << weight * 0.0899;
break;
}
cout << endl;
}

void str_to_upper(string& str)
{
for(int i = 0; i < str.length(); i++)
{
str.at(i) = toupper(char(str.at(i)));
}
}[/code]

Terrible, I know, but can it be improved?

Read full topic
